name: Premature Pitch Conversation

transcript.content: Good morning. I have about 30 minutes for this call.
Great to meet you! I'm really excited to tell you about our cloud migration solution. We've helped dozens of manufacturing companies modernize their infrastructure.
I see. We haven't even discussed what our situation is yet.
Of course! Let me tell you what we offer - our platform provides 99.9% uptime guarantee and can reduce your IT costs by up to 40%. It's the best solution on the market.
I've heard that claim from every vendor. You don't even know what our challenges are.
You're absolutely right. What systems are you currently using?
We have on-premise servers that are about 7 years old.
Perfect! Our solution is ideal for modernizing legacy infrastructure. We can provide you with a great deal if you sign up this quarter - it's a limited time offer.
I don't respond to pressure tactics. Is there a point to this conversation beyond selling me something?
I apologize if it came across that way. Trust me, we genuinely want to help your business succeed.
Trust is earned, not requested. I think we're done here.

notes: Anti-pattern: Opens with pitch, uses forbidden vocabulary ('best on market', 'guarantee', 'great deal', 'limited time', 'trust me'), no discovery questions, doesn't understand customer's situation before proposing solutions
